title: 時論廣場》兩岸好 才有國際空間（李正修）
summary: 第79屆聯合國大會將於10日開議，賴政府定調今年推動聯合國案的首要任務，是駁斥聯大第2758號決議遭扭曲，要求聯合國秘書處停止錯誤援引。只不過，賴政府應心知肚明，會有多少國家願意冒著與北京撕破臉的風險，公開反駁2758號決議？截至目前為止，除了美澳，其他國家對此根本未置一詞，顯見該議題的高度敏感性。 中共近年以機艦擾台方式持續施壓台灣，亦開始針對台海現狀推動法律戰，有意在國際社會營造有利其推進兩岸...
text: 第79屆聯合國大會將於10日開議，賴政府定調今年推動聯合國案的首要任務，是駁斥聯大第2758號決議遭扭曲，要求聯合國秘書處停止錯誤援引。只不過，賴政府應心知肚明，會有多少國家願意冒著與北京撕破臉的風險，公開反駁2758號決議？截至目前為止，除了美澳，其他國家對此根本未置一詞，顯見該議題的高度敏感性。 中共近年以機艦擾台方式持續施壓台灣，亦開始針對台海現狀推動法律戰，有意在國際社會營造有利其推進兩岸統一的法理論述。從2005年的《反分裂國家法》到今年出台的《關於依法懲治台獨頑固分子分裂國家、煽動分裂國家犯罪的意見》即是如此盤算，現在更意圖以聯合國2758號決議徹底斷絕中華民國的國際空間。 對此，美國近年帶頭開始質疑中共扭曲2758號對台灣地位的結論，認為該決議只處理聯合國的「中國席位」問題，並未觸及台灣地位。今年在台舉行的「對中政策跨國議會聯盟」（IPAC）通過決議案範本，要求各會員國應積極在各國國會通過，近日則有美國前駐聯合國大使海利及澳洲國會疾呼重新檢討2758號決議及台灣參與國際社會的聲音。 所有國人共同期盼，中華民國能爭取到應有的國際人格及相對應的國際參與，所以對於國際社會的支持皆予以感謝。然而，倘若這樣的口頭聲明無法落實到具體行動，恐怕最後淪為「竹籃子打水一場空」的結局。海利說得沒錯，應由台灣及美國主動要求聯合國召開關於2758號決議的公聽會，若能有更多主要國家的響應，或許能產生些微漣漪效應。 國人希望能以正常國家身分參與國際活動的深切期盼是可理解的。然而，鑒於兩岸關係的特殊性，台灣的選項其實有限，絕非像民進黨在國內嗆聲的作法就能輕易成功，否則兩岸也無須為了中國代表權拼鬥20多年才有結果。 首先，2758號決議提到，「承認中華人民共和國政府的代表是中國在聯合國組織的唯一合法代表，並驅逐蔣介石代表」，並未提及台灣地位，所以也成了民進黨欲推翻決議的主要理由。然而，當時的蔣介石是有效統治台灣的中華民國總統，因此綠營的說詞難被接受。唯一解方就是完全擺脫中華民國體制、成立新的主權獨立國家，進而向聯合國提出新的入會申請。問題是：民進黨做得到嗎？ 其次，我國不再爭取唯一中國代表權，而是尋求以「一國兩席」的途徑解套。換言之，兩岸皆主張台灣與大陸同屬一個中國，唯目前有兩個各自獨立的政府及其管轄範圍，因此我國亦有權力加入聯合國。對此，堅持憲法之兩岸定位以打破中華民國國際地位僵局，應是我方反制的關鍵。 民進黨希望加入聯合國以凸顯兩岸互不隸屬與台灣是主權獨立國家的事實，卻從未嚴肅認真看待我國所面臨的國際現實處境，只想以旁門左道吸引選票，遑論該如何解決，根本就是治絲益棼。依其想像，除非美國等主要國家都接受台灣法理獨立，否則此路徑毫無成功的可能性。 事實上，曾與中共在外交場合交手的人都知道，沒有和睦的兩岸關係，台灣的國際空間必然受到衝擊。或許民進黨的思維與眾不同，只想藉由加入聯合國的主張，打著「抗中保台」旗號招搖撞騙贏得並鞏固政權，其他都是順帶獲得的意外紅利。
translated_summary: The 79th UN General Assembly will open on the 10th. The Lai government has set the tone that the primary task of promoting the UN case this year is to refute the distortion of UN General Assembly Resolution 2758 and ask the UN Secretariat to stop citing it incorrectly. However, the Lai government should know very well how many countries are willing to risk breaking up with Beijing and publicly refute Resolution 2758? So far, except for the United States and Australia, other countries have not said a word about this, which shows the high sensitivity of this issue. In recent years, the Chinese Communist Party has continued to put pressure on Taiwan by harassing Taiwan with aircraft and ships, and has also begun to promote a legal battle against the status quo in the Taiwan Strait, intending to create a legal theory in the international community that is conducive to its promotion of cross-strait reunification. This has been the plan from the Anti-Secession Law of 2005 to the Opinions on Punishing the Crimes of Secession and Inciting Secession by Taiwan Independence Stubborn Elements in Accordance with the Law this year. Now, they are trying to completely cut off the international space of the Republic of China with UN Resolution 2758. In recent years, the United States has taken the lead in questioning the CCP's distortion of the conclusion of Resolution 2758 on Taiwan's status, believing that the resolution only deals with the issue of "China's seat" in the United Nations and does not touch on Taiwan's status. The Inter-Parliamentary Alliance on China (IPAC) held in Taiwan this year passed a model resolution, requiring member states to actively pass it in their respective parliaments. Recently, former U.S. Ambassador to the United Nations Nikki Haley and the Australian Parliament have called for a review of Resolution 2758 and Taiwan's participation in the international community. All Taiwanese people hope that the Republic of China can gain the international personality and corresponding international participation it deserves, so they are grateful for the support of the international community. However, if such verbal statements cannot be implemented into concrete actions, I am afraid that the end result will be "a basket full of water". Haley is right. Taiwan and the United States should take the initiative to request the United Nations to hold a public hearing on Resolution 2758. If more major countries respond, it may produce a slight ripple effect. The deep desire of the Chinese people to participate in international activities as a normal country is understandable. However, in view of the special nature of cross-strait relations, Taiwan's options are actually limited. It is by no means easy to succeed by the DPP's domestic whistle. Otherwise, the two sides would not have to fight for more than 20 years for China's representation rights to achieve results. First of all, Resolution 2758 mentioned that "recognizes the representatives of the Government of the People's Republic of China as the sole legitimate representatives of China in the United Nations and expel the representatives of Chiang Kai-shek", but did not mention Taiwan's status, so it became the main reason for the DPP to overturn the resolution. However, Chiang Kai-shek was the president of the Republic of China who effectively ruled Taiwan at the time, so the Green Camp's argument was difficult to accept. The only solution is to completely get rid of the Republic of China system, establish a new sovereign and independent country, and then submit a new application for membership in the United Nations. The question is: Can the DPP do it? Secondly, our country no longer strives for the sole representation of China, but seeks to solve the problem with the "one country, two seats" approach. In other words, both sides of the Taiwan Strait advocate that Taiwan and the mainland belong to the same China, but currently there are two independent governments and their jurisdictions, so our country also has the right to join the United Nations. In this regard, adhering to the cross-strait positioning of the Constitution to break the deadlock in the international status of the Republic of China should be the key to our counterattack. The DPP hopes to join the United Nations to highlight the fact that the two sides of the Taiwan Strait are not subordinate to each other and that Taiwan is a sovereign and independent country. However, it has never taken the international reality facing our country seriously. It only wants to attract votes by unconventional means, not to mention how to solve the problem. This is simply a way to make things worse. According to its imagination, unless major countries such as the United States accept Taiwan's legal independence, there is no possibility of success on this path. In fact, anyone who has had diplomatic exchanges with the Chinese Communist Party knows that without harmonious cross-strait relations, Taiwan's international space will inevitably be impacted. Perhaps the DPP's thinking is different from others. It only wants to win and consolidate its regime by advocating to join the United Nations under the banner of "resisting China and protecting Taiwan", and everything else is just an unexpected bonus.

title: 介文汲蕭旭岑指干預柯文哲案 AIT：不介入台灣司法事務
summary: （9/14 17:17 更新） （中央社記者吳書緯、溫貴香台北14日電）民眾黨主席柯文哲因京華城案遭羈押禁見，前駐紐西蘭大使介文汲日前指此事續辦，AIT將出手干預。美國在台協會今天表示，尊重台灣的民主制度，也尊重台灣對法治的支持，「我們不介入台灣的司法事務」。 介文汲日前在政論節目上指出，京華城案若續辦，美國在台協會（AIT）將出手干預；馬英九基金會執行長蕭旭岑昨天也稱AIT關切「百分之百是真的」...
text: （9/14 17:17 更新） （中央社記者吳書緯、溫貴香台北14日電）民眾黨主席柯文哲因京華城案遭羈押禁見，前駐紐西蘭大使介文汲日前指此事續辦，AIT將出手干預。美國在台協會今天表示，尊重台灣的民主制度，也尊重台灣對法治的支持，「我們不介入台灣的司法事務」。 介文汲日前在政論節目上指出，京華城案若續辦，美國在台協會（AIT）將出手干預；馬英九基金會執行長蕭旭岑昨天也稱AIT關切「百分之百是真的」。 中央社記者今天詢問AIT回應，AIT發言人表示，美國在台協會尊重台灣的民主制度，也尊重台灣對法治的支持，「我們不介入台灣的司法事務」。 對於相關傳言，熟悉對外事務人士分析，從訊息鏈來看，背後認知作戰痕跡非常明顯。中方與在台協力者論調相同、連動性強，預判目的是誣指AIT將干預台灣司法，營造台灣司法體系不被美方信任假象，進而讓台灣社會也對司法沒有信心。 對於AIT的回應，涉外人士認為，這直接粉碎中國與在台協力者的認知作戰。放眼望去，全球所有外國政府，沒有任何民主國家關切台灣司法個案，只有中國國台辦針對該案發表意見，誣指台灣司法。 涉外人士提到，2023年12月「澳洲戰略政策研究所」（ASPI）曾發表研究報告指出，在YouTube平台上有至少30個頻道推廣親華與反美立場影片，宣傳重點包括在美國對中國實施制裁的情況下，中國為「贏得中美科技戰」所做的努力等，致力傳播支持華為和反蘋果內容，目的是利用台灣媒體人的觀點，形塑對中國有利的世界觀。 他進一步說，中國內部經濟日益惡化，不僅消費零售、出口與固定資產投資等「三駕馬車」持續下滑，又面臨西方國家的經濟與科技制裁，已被壓得喘不過氣，北京政府因此不得不採取虛張聲勢的手段轉移國內壓力，掩蓋其疲弱的經濟狀況。（編輯：張均懋）1130914 柯文哲 媒體宣傳費預算爭議 朱立倫：民主之恥 日經：藍白猛批司法淪民進黨打手 專家憂法治政治化 本網站之文字、圖片及影音，非經授權，不得轉載、公開播送或公開傳輸及利用。
translated_summary: (Updated at 17:17 on 9/14) (Central News Agency reporters Wu Shuwei and Wen Guixiang, Taipei, 14th) People's Party Chairman Ko Wen-je has been detained and denied access to visitors due to the Jinghuacheng case. Former Ambassador to New Zealand Jie Wen-chi recently said that if the matter continues, the AIT will intervene. The American Institute in Taiwan said today that it respects Taiwan's democratic system and its support for the rule of law. "We do not interfere in Taiwan's judicial affairs." Jie Wen-chi recently pointed out on a political talk show that if the Jinghuacheng case continues, the American Institute in Taiwan (AIT) will intervene; Ma Ying-jeou Foundation CEO Xiao Xucen also said yesterday that AIT's concerns are "100% true." When a Central News Agency reporter asked about the AIT's response today, an AIT spokesperson said that the American Institute in Taiwan respects Taiwan's democratic system and its support for the rule of law, and "we do not interfere in Taiwan's judicial affairs." Regarding the relevant rumors, people familiar with foreign affairs analyzed that from the information chain, the traces of cognitive warfare behind it are very obvious. China and its collaborators in Taiwan have the same rhetoric and strong linkage. The purpose of the prediction is to falsely accuse AIT of interfering in Taiwan's judiciary and create the illusion that Taiwan's judicial system is not trusted by the United States, thereby making Taiwanese society lose confidence in the judiciary. Regarding the AIT's response, people familiar with foreign affairs believe that this directly shatters China's cognitive warfare with its collaborators in Taiwan. Looking around, among all foreign governments in the world, no democratic country is concerned about the Taiwan judicial case. Only China's Taiwan Affairs Office has expressed opinions on the case and slandered Taiwan's judiciary. Foreign affairs personnel mentioned that in December 2023, the Australian Strategic Policy Institute (ASPI) published a research report pointing out that there are at least 30 channels on the YouTube platform that promote pro-China and anti-US videos. The focus of the propaganda includes China's efforts to "win the Sino-US technology war" under the circumstances of US sanctions against China. It is committed to spreading content that supports Huawei and is anti-Apple. The purpose is to use the views of Taiwanese media people to shape a worldview that is beneficial to China. He further said that China's domestic economy is deteriorating day by day. Not only are the "three horses" such as consumer retail, exports and fixed asset investment continuing to decline, but it is also facing economic and technological sanctions from Western countries. It has been overwhelmed. Therefore, the Beijing government has to resort to false means to shift domestic pressure and cover up its weak economic situation. (Editor: Zhang Junmao) 1130914 Ke Wenzhe Media publicity budget dispute Zhu Lilun: shame of democracy Nikkei: Blue and White fiercely criticize the judiciary for being a DPP thug. Experts worry about the politicization of the rule of law. The text, pictures and videos on this website shall not be reproduced, publicly broadcasted or publicly transmitted or used without authorization.

title: 中国西部游受海外游客青睐_腾讯新闻
summary: 新华社成都9月2日电 题：中国西部游受海外游客青睐 新华社记者张超群 '来成都，我感受到美丽的环境、悠然的城市生活，也了解到更多中国文化。'美国高中毕业生阿帕尔娜·维斯瓦纳坦说，这是她8月旅行的'成都印象'。'我尤其喜欢大熊猫，在我看来它们是自然保护和中国文化的最佳'代言人'。' 今年暑期，中国入境旅游持续升温，更多海外游客将中国作为其旅游休闲目的地，不少人选择到中国西部省份深度游。 去哪儿平台显...
text: 新华社成都9月2日电 题：中国西部游受海外游客青睐 新华社记者张超群 '来成都，我感受到美丽的环境、悠然的城市生活，也了解到更多中国文化。'美国高中毕业生阿帕尔娜·维斯瓦纳坦说，这是她8月旅行的'成都印象'。'我尤其喜欢大熊猫，在我看来它们是自然保护和中国文化的最佳'代言人'。' 今年暑期，中国入境旅游持续升温，更多海外游客将中国作为其旅游休闲目的地，不少人选择到中国西部省份深度游。 去哪儿平台显示，使用非中国护照预订国内航线机票的旅客预订量，同比2023年增长1.8倍，其中有超过10%的外国游客在半年之内来了中国两次。成都、西安、重庆等西部城市位居外国旅客在华乘飞机热门目的地前十。 外国游客在四川旅游途中拍摄美食（6月7日摄）。新华社记者 张超群 摄 '中国有很多世界遗产，世界上有很多人对此非常感兴趣。'联合国世界旅游组织特别顾问玛丽-皮埃尔·布歇·奥利耶告诉记者，'如今，人们希望了解一个更多元的中国，感受不同的风情。中国四川、贵州、云南这些西部省份的旅游业和少数民族文化结合，在国际上知名度较高。' 英国牛津大学学生迈尔斯·金7月来到四川雅安，和朋友们一道走进原生态的自然保护区徒步登山，并将沿途的景色创作成一幅版画作品。'我们登山途中看到了连绵的山脉和苍翠的树林，我尝试用这幅画重现那个场景，传递出宁静、平和的感觉。' 自去年中国陆续推出免签入境政策以来，外籍入境游客数量持续增加。'China Travel'成为海外互联网热词，让更多外国人感受不一样的中国。 目前，中国对15国试行免签入境15天政策，将144小时过境免签政策适用范围增至37个口岸、54个国家。据国家移民管理局最新统计，今年1至7月，全国各口岸入境外国人1725.4万人次，同比增长129.9%；签发口岸签证84.6万证次，同比上升182.9%。来华旅游外国人预计拉动消费超1000亿元。 中国-西班牙旅游平台yunxi.es创始人安东尼奥·泰黑罗刚刚完成一次跨越陕西、四川、重庆的旅行。'在中国西部，我们看到了不一样的东西，给我留下了深刻的印象。'他认为，到中国西部感受原汁原味的文化、欣赏美丽的自然风景会排在西班牙人旅游愿望清单前列。 有30多年西班牙旅行社运营经验的安东尼奥·佩雷格林曾每年为2000多名来华西班牙游客提供服务。'虽然西班牙人对中国旅游并不陌生，但超过90%去的是北京、上海这些大城市，西班牙人对整个中国并不十分了解。' 佩雷格林四年前开始转型小规模定制深度游服务，'来中国三次'成为他的口头禅。'我告诉客户，中国太大了，至少需要去三次，其中一次就是中国西部。已经有一些客户正在准备第三、第四次行程，不同的省份、不同的经历让他们感到兴奋。' 外国游客在四川乐山乘船游览乐山大佛（6月7日摄）。新华社记者 张超群 摄 2021年成都天府国际机场启用，让成都成为中国大陆第三个拥有两个国际枢纽机场的城市，便捷的交通拉近了空间的距离。据飞常准公布的数据显示，今年暑运首月，成都天府机场起降架次超过3万架次。 '成都对入境游而言，不仅是目的地，也是集散地。'成都市文化广电旅游局相关负责人介绍，由成都入境的外籍游客数量呈逐年增加的态势。'日韩游客喜欢诗词和三国文化、欧美游客更偏向民族文化和自然风情，成都将根据海外不同地域游客的喜好，做好精准推介。'他坦言，西部城市还需要更多具国际识别度的标签和持续的旅游推广。 去哪儿大数据研究院研究员蔡木子介绍，今年来华外国人爱坐高铁、爱逛小城，也不乏来华'特种兵'式旅游的外国旅客。去哪儿平台上，一位俄罗斯旅客半年内到访了天津、日照、宁波等16个城市；一位土耳其旅客到访了广州、济南、青岛等12个城市。 巴基斯坦来的乌扎尔·汗就是一位'爱逛小城'的游客。今年夏天，他来到四川西昌体验凉山彝族火把节，围着篝火起舞，和当地人唱起山歌。'这真是一次全新的体验。'他说。 今年8月，热爱音乐的俄罗斯姑娘伊丽莎白·西德内瓦特地报名了'唱歌学中文·唱行成都'来华研学营，只为了解中国音乐艺术。和伙伴们一起与成都二十四伎乐国风乐团交流后，她告诉记者：'中国传统乐器的声音很特别，中国人保留传统文化的努力也让我很感动。' 玛丽-皮埃尔·布歇·奥利耶认为，文化和自然的差异是旅游的动力，中国西部丰富的旅游资源极具潜力。她期待中国西部省份可以推出更多高品质的旅游线路和服务。 查看原图 76K
translated_summary:
Xinhua News Agency Chengdu, September 2. Question: Western China tours are favored by overseas tourists
 Xinhua News Agency reporter Zhang Chaoqun
 'When I came to Chengdu, I felt the beautiful environment, leisurely city life, and learned more about Chinese culture.' American high school graduate Apalna Viswanathan said this was her 'impression of Chengdu' during her August trip. ' I especially like giant pandas, who in my opinion are the best 'speakers' for nature conservation and Chinese culture. '
 This summer, China's inbound tourism continues to heat up. More overseas tourists are using China as their travel and leisure destination, and many people choose to travel in depth to China's western provinces.
 The Qunar platform shows that the number of passenger bookings using non-Chinese passports to book domestic route tickets increased 1.8 times year-on-year in 2023, with more than 10% of foreign tourists coming to China twice within six months. Western cities such as Chengdu, Xi'an, and Chongqing rank among the top ten popular destinations for foreign tourists flying in China.
 Foreign tourists take delicious food while traveling in Sichuan (photo taken on June 7). Photo by Xinhua News Agency reporter Zhang Chaoqun
 'China has many world heritage sites and many people around the world are very interested in them.' Marie-Pierre Boucher-Olier, special adviser to the United Nations World Tourism Organization, told reporters, 'Today, people want to know about a more diverse China and feel different styles. The combination of tourism and ethnic minority culture in China's western provinces of Sichuan, Guizhou, and Yunnan is well-known internationally. '
 Miles King, a student at the University of Oxford in the UK, came to Ya'an, Sichuan in July. He walked into the original nature reserve with his friends and hiked the mountain, and created a print of the scenery along the way.' We saw continuous mountains and lush woods on our way up the mountain, and I tried to recreate that scene with this painting, conveying a sense of tranquility and peace.'
 Since China successively launched visa-free entry policies last year, the number of foreign tourists has continued to increase. ' China Travel' has become a hot word on the overseas Internet, allowing more foreigners to experience a different China.
 At present, China has piloted a 15-day visa-free entry policy for 15 countries, increasing the scope of application of the 144-hour transit visa-free policy to 37 ports and 54 countries. According to the latest statistics from the National Immigration Administration, from January to July this year, 17.254 million foreigners entered ports across the country, a year-on-year increase of 129.9%; 846,000 port visas were issued, a year-on-year increase of 182.9%. Foreigners traveling to China are expected to drive consumption of more than 100 billion yuan.
 China-Spain travel platform yunxi. Antonio Taiheiro, founder of es, has just completed a trip across Shaanxi, Sichuan and Chongqing. ' In western China, we saw something different and left a deep impression on me.' He believes that going to western China to experience the original culture and appreciate the beautiful natural scenery will be at the top of the Spanish travel wish list.
 Antonio Peregrine, who has more than 30 years of experience in operating Spanish travel agencies, has served more than 2,000 Spanish tourists to China every year. ' Although Spaniards are no strangers to traveling to China, more than 90% go to big cities such as Beijing and Shanghai, and Spaniards do not know much about China as a whole. '
 Peregrine began transforming into a small-scale customized in-depth tour service four years ago, and 'coming to China three times' became his mantra.' I told my clients that China is too big and needs to be visited at least three times, one of which is in western China. There are already some customers preparing for their third and fourth trips, and they are excited by different provinces and different experiences. '
 Foreign tourists take a boat trip to Leshan Buddha in Leshan, Sichuan (photo taken on June 7). Photo by Xinhua News Agency reporter Zhang Chaoqun
 The opening of Chengdu Tianfu International Airport in 2021 will make Chengdu the third city in mainland China to have two international hub airports, and convenient transportation has shortened the distance between spaces. According to data released by Feichangzhun, in the first month of this year's summer season, Chengdu Tianfu Airport took off and landed more than 30,000 times.
 'Chengdu is not only a destination for inbound tourists, but also a distribution center.' According to the relevant person in charge of the Chengdu Municipal Culture, Radio, Television and Tourism Bureau, the number of foreign tourists entering Chengdu is increasing year by year. ' Japanese and Korean tourists like poetry and the culture of the Three Kingdoms, while European and American tourists prefer national culture and natural customs. Chengdu will make precise recommendations based on the preferences of overseas tourists from different regions. ' He admitted that western cities also need more internationally recognized labels and continued tourism promotion.
 Cai Muzi, a researcher at Qunar Big Data Research Institute, said that foreigners coming to China this year like to take high-speed rail and visit small towns, and there are also foreign tourists who come to China for 'special forces'-style travel. On the Qunar platform, a Russian tourist visited 16 cities including Tianjin, Rizhao, and Ningbo within six months; a Turkish tourist visited 12 cities including Guangzhou, Jinan, and Qingdao.
 Uzar Khan from Pakistan is a tourist who 'loves to visit small towns'. This summer, he came to Xichang, Sichuan to experience the Liangshan Yi Torch Festival, danced around the bonfire, and sang folk songs with the locals.' This is a really new experience.' He said.
 In August this year, Elizabeth Sidnevat, a Russian girl who loves music, signed up for the "Singing to Learn Chinese·Singing in Chengdu" to come to China to study camp just to understand Chinese music and art. After communicating with her partners with the Chengdu Twenty-Four Music Guofeng Orchestra, she told reporters: 'The sound of traditional Chinese musical instruments is very special, and I am also very moved by the Chinese people's efforts to retain traditional culture.'
 Marie-Pierre Boucher-Olier believes that cultural and natural differences are the driving force for tourism, and the rich tourism resources in western China have great potential. She looks forward to more high-quality tourism routes and services in China's western provinces.
 View original image 76K

language: 极具历史价值的逨盘，内铸铭文21行372字，以第一人称记述了单氏家族8代人辅佐西周12代天子征战、理政的故事，第一次印证了《史记》所记载的西周诸王世系的次序，意义非凡
title: 鉴往知来，跟着总书记学历史丨在'青铜史诗'里，触摸'中国'脉搏
summary: '古公亶父，来朝走马。率西水浒，至于岐下。' 3000多年前，周人跋山涉水，来到岐山脚下定居繁衍——厚土之上，强盛的西周由此肇启，灿烂的礼乐由此孕育。 陕西宝鸡，浸染周风秦韵，尽显雄浑之姿、磅礴之气。凝结当时先进技术的青铜器，成为'礼'的载体
text: 因出土大量青铜器，宝鸡也成为享誉世界的'青铜器之乡'。 9月10日下午，习近平总书记考察了宝鸡青铜器博物院。跟随总书记的脚步，我们一起触摸'青铜史诗'背后，...
link: 因出土大量青铜器，宝鸡也成为享誉世界的'青铜器之乡'。 9月10日下午，习近平总书记考察了宝鸡青铜器博物院。跟随总书记的脚步，我们一起触摸'青铜史诗'背后，那绵延数千年的'中国'脉搏，感知文脉赓续的深刻启迪。 宅兹中国 走进位于宝鸡市区的中华石鼓园，仿佛推开了历史的大门。坐落其中的宝鸡青铜器博物院，外观就给人强烈的视觉震撼——它依山而建，南依秦岭、北望渭水，采用传统高台门阙形式，'平台五鼎'的造型层层递进、气势恢弘。 这座国家一级博物馆里，'镇院之宝'，当属'何尊'。 远观'国宝'，通高38.5厘米，通体饰有四条透雕扉棱，整齐有序，极富立体感。 上前仔细端详，何尊纹饰华丽，腹部雕有饕餮兽面纹，粗大卷曲的兽角翘出器外，颇有腾跃欲食的动感。器形上圆下方，体现着古人'天圆地方'的宇宙观。 极为珍贵的是，何尊腹底铭文中，有'宅兹中国'四个字——这是迄今发现的'中国'一词最早的来源。 何以为尊?我有'中国'—— 这两个字，已深深嵌入每一个华夏儿女的心底，成为自信、自立的精神源头。历史漫漫、时空流转，薪火相传的中华文明，成为世界上唯一绵延不断且以国家形态发展至今的伟大文明。 '我们的文化自信就是从真正能证明我们的久远历史中来。'习近平总书记情真意切。国之重器，浑厚凝重，昭示中华儿女敬畏历史、守望岁月、呵护文明。 何以中国 青铜铸宝，传之千年。漫步院中，厚重之感扑面而来。 精彩不止何尊。宝鸡青铜器博物院青铜器数量多、种类全、价值高，可谓一座展现周秦文化、中华文明的'艺术宝库'。 移步向前，国家一级文物胡簋映入眼帘。它通高59厘米，重60公斤，是迄今唯一有明确纪年的西周厉王自作器，也是目前发现最大的青铜簋，有'簋王'之称
ilr_quantized: …… 金文载史，煌煌春秋。一件件'重器'，铭文记录着数千年前的为政准则或国之大事，堪称一部部'青铜史书'。 '中华优秀传统文化已经成为中华民族的基因，植根在中国人内心，潜移默化影响着中国人的思想方式和行为方式。'习近平总书记感触颇深。 '我们现在是距离中华民族文化复兴最近的一个时代。我们自信起来了。人们怎么想问题，都跟五千年文化积淀下来的基因血脉有关。'有活水滋养，方能积蓄力量。 崇仁爱、重民本、尚和合、求大同……璀璨厚重的中华文化、源远流长的中华文明，蕴藏着历史与未来的密码，也展示了中国式现代化道路上，基于国情的中国特色、基于文化的独特优势。 当是中国 泛黄的史籍、斑驳的青铜器，从不曾老去。跨入新时代，它们茁发生命力。 2022年，北京冬奥会吸引了全世界的目光。仪式火种台的创意灵感，便源自中国传统青铜礼器'何尊'—— 以'承天载物'为理念，采用尊的曲线造型，祥云纹路由下而上，渐化为雪花
ilr_range: 红色丝带飘逸飞舞、环绕向上，与火炬设计和谐统一。 这一刻，冬奥之火'邂逅'青铜之光，共同浇灌出中国人穿越历史的'独有浪漫'，也促成了传统与现代、科技与激情的完美融合。 2023年，古城西安，首届中国—中亚峰会圆满举行。在赠送中亚国家元首的礼品中，有一件'何尊'—— '长安复携手，再顾重千金'，用友谊与合作筑梦人类命运共同体。这一刻，熠熠生辉的'何尊'，荟萃古今、融通中外，彰显大国盛世风采。 '要坚定文化自信、担当使命、奋发有为，共同努力创造属于我们这个时代的新文化，建设中华民族现代文明。'习近平总书记殷殷嘱托。 '我们愿同国际社会一道，努力开创世界各国人文交流、文化交融、民心相通新局面，让世界文明百花园姹紫嫣红、生机盎然。'言之切切，道尽古老文明深处的智慧与理想。 青铜无言，春秋为证。历史的巨笔，正擘画今朝，启迪未来。 策划：杜尚泽、张铁 撰文：高炳 海报：李艳 摄影：新华社记者 王晔 视觉：赖向东、毕晓洋 编辑：李建广、安博文 校检：吴玥 来源：人民日报客户端
ilr_regressed:
'Gu Gongdanfu, come and go. Lead the Western Water Margin to Qixia. '
 More than 3,000 years ago, the Zhou people traveled across mountains and rivers and came to the foot of Qishan Mountain to settle and reproduce on the thick soil. The powerful Western Zhou Dynasty began from this, and brilliant rituals and music were born from this.
 Shaanxi Baoji is soaked with the charm of Zhou Feng and Qin, showing its majestic appearance and majestic aura. Bronze vessels condensed with the advanced technology at that time became the carrier of 'ritual'; because a large number of bronze vessels were unearthed, Baoji also became the world-renowned 'Hometown of Bronze'.
 On the afternoon of September 10, General Secretary Xi Jinping inspected the Baoji Bronze Museum. Following in the footsteps of the General Secretary, we touch the 'Chinese' pulse behind the 'Bronze Epic' that stretches for thousands of years, and feel the continuous profound enlightenment of the text.
 Zhaizi China
 Walking into the Zhonghua Shigu Garden located in Baoji City seems to have opened the door to history. The appearance of the Baoji Bronze Museum located in it gives people a strong visual shock. It is built on the mountain, facing the Qinling Mountains to the south and the Wei River to the north. It adopts the traditional high platform gate form, and the shape of the "Five Cauldrons on the Platform" is progressive and majestic.
 In this national first-class museum, the 'Treasure of the Town Courtyard' must belong to 'He Zun'.
 Looking at the 'National Treasure' from a distance, it is 38.5 cm high and is decorated with four open-cut door edges. It is neat and orderly and has a three-dimensional feel.
 Look forward and look carefully. He Zun's pattern is gorgeous, with a gluttonous animal face pattern carved on his abdomen. The thick and curly animal horns are raised out of the vessel, giving him a sense of excitement and desire. The shape of the instrument is round and below, reflecting the ancient people's cosmology of "the sky is round and the place is round".
 What is extremely precious is that the inscription on the bottom of He Zun's abdomen contains the four words —— 'Zhaizi China'. This is the earliest source of the word 'China' discovered so far.
 Why respect? I have 'China'——
 These two words have been deeply embedded in the hearts of every Chinese son and daughter, becoming the spiritual source of self-confidence and self-reliance. The Chinese civilization, which has a long history, time and space, and is passed down from generation to generation, has become the only great civilization in the world that continues to develop in the form of a country to this day.
 'Our cultural confidence comes from a long history that truly proves us.' General Secretary Xi Jinping is sincere. The country's important weapon is rich and solemn, which shows that the Chinese people respect history, watch over the years, and protect civilization.
 Why China
 Bronze cast treasure, passed down for thousands of years. While walking in the courtyard, a heavy feeling hit my face.
 There is more to it than just being wonderful. Baoji Bronze Museum has a large number of bronzes, a wide range of types, and high value. It can be said to be an "art treasure house" that displays Zhou and Qin culture and Chinese civilization.
 Moving forward, Hu Gui, a national first-class cultural relic, came into view. It is 59 centimeters high and weighs 60 kilograms. It is the only self-made weapon of King Li of the Western Zhou Dynasty with a clear date. It is also the largest bronze Gui discovered so far and is known as the "King of Gui"
 The plate with great historical value contains 21 lines and 372 words of inscriptions. It records in the first person the story of 8 generations of the Shan family assisting the 12 generations of emperors of the Western Zhou Dynasty in their campaigns and governance. It confirms for the first time that 《 historical records 》 record The order of the lineages of the kings of the Western Zhou Dynasty is of great significance;
 . . . . .
 The golden text records history, the glorious spring and autumn. Each piece of "heavy weapon" has inscriptions recording the political norms or major national events thousands of years ago, which can be called "bronze history books".
 'China's excellent traditional culture has become the gene of the Chinese nation, rooted in the hearts of the Chinese people, and subtly affects the way the Chinese people think and behave.' General Secretary Xi Jinping felt deeply.
 'We are now the closest era to the cultural rejuvenation of the Chinese nation. We became confident. What people think about the problem is related to the genetic bloodline accumulated by five thousand years of culture. ' Only when you are nourished by living water can you accumulate strength.
 Chongrenai, value the people, respect harmony, and seek great harmony. . . . . . . . . . . . The splendid and profound Chinese culture and the long-standing Chinese civilization contain the code of history and future. It also demonstrates the Chinese characteristics and culture based on national conditions on the road of Chinese modernization. unique advantages.
 Be China
 The yellowed historical records and mottled bronzes have never aged. Entering a new era, they thrive.
 In 2022, the Beijing Winter Olympics attracted the attention of the world. The creative inspiration for the ceremonial tinderstand comes from the traditional Chinese bronze ritual vessel 'He Zun'——
 With the concept of "carrying the sky and carrying things", it adopts the curved shape of Zun, and the auspicious cloud pattern gradually turns into snowflakes from bottom to top; the red ribbon flies and surrounds upward, harmoniously unified with the torch design.
 At this moment, the Winter Olympics fire 'encounters' the bronze light, jointly watering out the 'unique romance' of Chinese people traveling through history, and also promoting the perfect integration of tradition and modernity, technology and passion.
 In 2023, in the ancient city of Xi'an, the first China — Central Asia Summit was successfully held. Among the gifts given to Central Asian heads of state is a 'He Zun'——
 'Chang'an joins hands again and cares about thousands of dollars', and uses friendship and cooperation to build a dream community with a shared future for mankind. At this moment, the shining "He Zun" gathers ancient and modern times, integrates China and foreign countries, and demonstrates the prosperity of a great country.
 'We must strengthen cultural confidence, shoulder the mission, work hard, work together to create a new culture of our era, and build the modern civilization of the Chinese nation.' General Secretary Xi Jinping earnestly entrusted.
 'We are willing to work with the international community to create a new situation of people-to-people and cultural exchanges, cultural integration, and people-to-people bonds among countries around the world, so that the gardens of world civilization will be colorful and full of vitality.' To put it bluntly, it expresses the wisdom and ideals deep in ancient civilization.
 The bronze is speechless, as evidenced by the Spring and Autumn Period. The huge stroke of history is painting the present and inspiring the future.
 Planning: Du Shangze, Zhang Tie
 Written by: Gao Bing
 Poster: Li Yan
 Photography: Xinhua News Agency reporter Wang Ye
 Vision: Lai Xiangdong, Bi Xiaoyang
 Editor: Li Jianguang, An Bowen
 School inspection: Wu Yue
 Source: People's Daily client
translated_summary: '古公亶父，来朝走马。率西水浒，至于岐下。' 3000多年前，周人跋山涉水，来到岐山脚下定居繁衍——厚土之上，强盛的西周由此肇启，灿烂的礼乐由此孕育。 陕西宝鸡，浸染周风秦韵，尽显雄浑之姿、磅礴之气。凝结当时先进技术的青铜器，成为'礼'的载体

title: 微软和贝莱德计划推出AI基础设施基金
summary: 4JUlRynabKc 作者：任重 world.huanqiu.com article 微软和贝莱德计划推出AI基础设施基金 /e3pmh22ph/e3pmh26vv 【环球时报综合报道】美国科技巨头微软和全球规模最大的资产管理集团之一贝莱德当地时间17日宣布，两家公司计划推出一只逾300亿美元的基金，聚焦数据中心和能源项目等'人工智能（AI）基础设施'建设投资。据路透社报道，贝莱德和微软表示，这...
text: 4JUlRynabKc 作者：任重 world.huanqiu.com article 微软和贝莱德计划推出AI基础设施基金 /e3pmh22ph/e3pmh26vv 【环球时报综合报道】美国科技巨头微软和全球规模最大的资产管理集团之一贝莱德当地时间17日宣布，两家公司计划推出一只逾300亿美元的基金，聚焦数据中心和能源项目等'人工智能（AI）基础设施'建设投资。据路透社报道，贝莱德和微软表示，这只基金名为'全球人工智能伙伴关系'，旨在帮助加强人工智能供应链和能源获取，将调动高达1000亿美元的总投资潜力。英国《金融时报》18日报道称，贝莱德与其新成立的基础设施投资部门共同发起的这一金融合作，将成为华尔街有史以来规模最大的投资工具之一。 路透社称，人工智能的天量计算需求决定了开展这项业务的科技公司必须数千个芯片串在一起，才能达到必要的数据处理能力，这导致对数据中心的需求激增。同时，用于深度学习和大规模数据处理的人工智能大模型需要大量的计算能力，也导致更高的能源需求。 《金融时报》称，人工智能的计算能力所需的能源远远超过以前的技术创新，并给现有的能源基础设施带来了压力。据国际能源署预测，到2026年，全球数据中心、人工智能和加密货币等高耗电行业的电力需求可能达到2022年的两倍多。（任重） 1726684292002 环球网版权作品，未经书面授权，严禁转载或镜像，违者将被追究法律责任。 责编：李雨童 环球时报 1726700113838 1 1 [] translated_summary: 4JUlRynabKc Author: Ren Zhong world.huanqiu.com article Microsoft and BlackRock plan to launch AI infrastructure fund /e3pmh22ph/e3pmh26vv [Global Times Comprehensive Report] US technology giant Microsoft and BlackRock, one of the world's largest asset management groups, announced on the 17th that the two companies plan to launch a fund of more than $30 billion, focusing on the construction of "artificial intelligence (AI) infrastructure" such as data centers and energy projects. According to Reuters, BlackRock and Microsoft said that this fund, called the "Global Artificial Intelligence Partnership", aims to help strengthen the artificial intelligence supply chain and energy acquisition, and will mobilize a total investment potential of up to $100 billion. The Financial Times reported on the 18th that this financial cooperation jointly initiated by BlackRock and its newly established infrastructure investment department will become one of the largest investment tools in Wall Street history. Reuters said that the huge computing needs of artificial intelligence determine that technology companies that carry out this business must string together thousands of chips to achieve the necessary data processing capabilities, which has led to a surge in demand for data centers. At the same time, large artificial intelligence models used for deep learning and large-scale data processing require a lot of computing power, which also leads to higher energy requirements. The Financial Times said that the computing power of artificial intelligence requires far more energy than previous technological innovations and puts pressure on existing energy infrastructure. According to the International Energy Agency, by 2026, the power demand of high-power-consuming industries such as global data centers, artificial intelligence and cryptocurrency may more than double that of 2022. title: 罢工持续，波音航空航天业务双双'折翼'
summary: 4JUlPumcDty 作者：甄翔 world.huanqiu.com article 罢工持续，波音航空航天业务双双'折翼' /e3pmh22ph/e3pmh26vv 【环球时报综合报道】美国波音公司3.3万名员工上周起发起罢工至今，其位于西雅图的两座工厂均已停摆。法新社18日报道称，波音同工会组织定于当天继续谈判，此前双方斡旋进展并不顺利，工会方面宣称波音对于谈判'态度不认真'。法新社称，波音...
text: 4JUlPumcDty 作者：甄翔 world.huanqiu.com article 罢工持续，波音航空航天业务双双'折翼' /e3pmh22ph/e3pmh26vv 【环球时报综合报道】美国波音公司3.3万名员工上周起发起罢工至今，其位于西雅图的两座工厂均已停摆。法新社18日报道称，波音同工会组织定于当天继续谈判，此前双方斡旋进展并不顺利，工会方面宣称波音对于谈判'态度不认真'。法新社称，波音工人不满的根本原因在于10多年来工资增长停滞，而美国国内通胀造成生活压力越来越大。 据美国《西雅图时报》报道，就在罢工持续之际，波音本周一宣布一系列内部降本节支措施，包括临时裁撤高管和经理、大面积中断供应商采购等。数据显示，受今年客机产量大幅减少影响，截至上季度末波音累计净债务高达450亿美元，其中120亿美元需在两年内偿还。业内人士分析，目前波音现金流高度紧张，几乎降至可维持运营的底线。鉴于同工会达成协议后，公司用人成本或将上升以及客机产能爬坡的艰难，波音可能到明年都无法形成正向现金流。报道援引美国资深航空金融分析师罗布·斯宾迦的话称，波音当下的问题不光是要在财务上翻身，还需要在几乎所有方面得到改善。 在罢工严重冲击客机制造业务的同时，波音航天部门的业务也难见起色，耗资16亿美元打造的'星际客机'飞船因多项安全指标不过关导致两名宇航员滞留太空事件仍在持续发酵。美国《时代》杂志在近日的报道中质疑：波音的'星际客机'飞船在任务失败后还有没有未来？ 美国哥伦比亚广播公司18日称，在罢工之前，波音已经面临种种财务挫折和声誉受损。自2019年年初以来，在一系列客机制造质量问题并于今年接受美国联邦监管机构调查后，波音过去5年亏损超过250亿美元，股价在过去5年内下跌超过60%。（甄翔） 1726684236098 环球网版权作品，未经书面授权，严禁转载或镜像，违者将被追究法律责任。 责编：李雨童 环球时报 1726699939162 1 1 [] translated_summary: 4JUlPumcDty Author: Zhen Xiang world.huanqiu.com article The strike continues, and Boeing's aerospace business has both "broken wings" /e3pmh22ph/e3pmh26vv [Global Times Comprehensive Report] 33,000 employees of Boeing in the United States have launched a strike since last week, and its two factories in Seattle have been shut down. Agence France-Presse reported on the 18th that Boeing and the union are scheduled to continue negotiations on the same day. The mediation between the two sides has not progressed smoothly before, and the union claimed that Boeing's "attitude is not serious" about the negotiations. Agence France-Presse said that the root cause of Boeing workers' dissatisfaction is that wage growth has stagnated for more than 10 years, and domestic inflation in the United States has caused increasing pressure on life. According to the Seattle Times, as the strike continued, Boeing announced a series of internal cost-cutting measures on Monday, including temporary layoffs of executives and managers, and large-scale interruptions to supplier procurement. Data shows that due to the sharp reduction in passenger aircraft production this year, Boeing's accumulated net debt reached US$45 billion at the end of the last quarter, of which US$12 billion needs to be repaid within two years. Industry insiders analyzed that Boeing's cash flow is currently highly tight, almost falling to the bottom line of maintaining operations. Given that the company's employment costs may rise after reaching an agreement with the union and the difficulty of climbing passenger aircraft production capacity, Boeing may not be able to form positive cash flow until next year. The report quoted Rob Spinga, a senior American aviation financial analyst, as saying that Boeing's current problem is not only to turn around financially, but also to improve in almost all aspects. While the strike has severely impacted the passenger aircraft manufacturing business, Boeing's aerospace business has also been difficult to improve. The "Starliner" spacecraft, which cost $1.6 billion to build, failed to pass a number of safety indicators, resulting in two astronauts stranded in space. The incident is still continuing to ferment. In a recent report, the US "Time" magazine questioned: Does Boeing's "Starliner" spacecraft have a future after the mission fails? The US Columbia Broadcasting Corporation said on the 18th that before the strike, Boeing had already faced various financial setbacks and reputational damage. Since the beginning of 2019, after a series of passenger aircraft manufacturing quality issues and being investigated by US federal regulators this year, Boeing has lost more than $25 billion in the past five years, and its stock price has fallen by more than 60% in the past five years. title: 外媒：墨西哥当选总统拒绝应邀访乌，称其'主要任务是管理墨西哥'
summary: 4JUPHZZ7NNf world.huanqiu.com article 外媒：墨西哥当选总统拒绝应邀访乌，称其'主要任务是管理墨西哥' /e3pmh22ph/e3pmh26vv 【环球网报道 见习记者 陈奕桐】据塔斯社等媒体18日报道，墨西哥当选总统克劳迪娅·辛鲍姆日前在被问及是否打算应乌克兰总统泽连斯基邀请访乌时，辛鲍姆表示拒绝，她表示将出席一些'重要的国际活动'，但其'主要任务是管理墨西哥...
text: 4JUPHZZ7NNf world.huanqiu.com article 外媒：墨西哥当选总统拒绝应邀访乌，称其'主要任务是管理墨西哥' /e3pmh22ph/e3pmh26vv 【环球网报道 见习记者 陈奕桐】据塔斯社等媒体18日报道，墨西哥当选总统克劳迪娅·辛鲍姆日前在被问及是否打算应乌克兰总统泽连斯基邀请访乌时，辛鲍姆表示拒绝，她表示将出席一些'重要的国际活动'，但其'主要任务是管理墨西哥'。 据塔斯社介绍，泽连斯基此前接受墨西哥《至上报》采访时表示，希望墨西哥现任总统洛佩斯访问乌克兰，也向当选总统辛鲍姆发出访乌邀请。 '我不这么认为。我再说一遍，我们是根据外交政策和宪法的原则行事的。'辛鲍姆被问及是否计划访问乌克兰时表示，'我们的外交政策由宪法决定。它非常明确、庄重且和平。寻求和平解决冲突的原则将成为我们外交政策的基础。这是我们的政策，并且将一直如此'。 塔斯社报道提到，辛鲍姆还表示，她的'主要任务是管理墨西哥'。'我将出席一些我们认为重要的国际活动，但我们不会经常出行——我们的责任在这里（墨西哥）。'辛鲍姆称。 据新华社此前介绍，辛鲍姆6月3日宣布赢得总统选举胜利，她将成为墨西哥史上首位女总统。俄罗斯媒体8月7日援引墨西哥驻俄罗斯大使馆消息报道，墨方已邀请俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔·普京出席在当地时间10月1日举行的墨西哥当选总统辛鲍姆的就职典礼。 针对墨方的邀请，此前，乌克兰方面提出请求，称如果普京应邀出席墨西哥当选总统克辛鲍姆的就职典礼，墨政府应逮捕前者，但该请求在今年8月8日遭墨西哥现任总统洛佩斯拒绝。 1726647066928 环球网版权作品，未经书面授权，严禁转载或镜像，违者将被追究法律责任。 责编：王怡 环球网 1726647066928 1 1 [] translated_summary: 4JUPHZZ7NNf world.huanqiu.com article Foreign media: Mexico's president-elect refuses invitation to visit Ukraine, saying his "main task is to manage Mexico" /e3pmh22ph/e3pmh26vv [Global Network Report Intern Reporter Chen Yitong] According to TASS and other media reports on the 18th, Mexican President-elect Claudia Sheinbaum was recently asked whether she intended to visit Ukraine at the invitation of Ukrainian President Zelensky. She refused. She said she would attend some "important international events", but her "main task is to manage Mexico". According to TASS, Zelensky had previously expressed in an interview with Mexico's "Supremacy" that he hoped that the current Mexican President Lopez would visit Ukraine and also invited President-elect Sheinbaum to visit Ukraine. "I don't think so. I repeat, we act in accordance with the principles of foreign policy and the Constitution." When asked if she planned to visit Ukraine, Sheinbaum said, "Our foreign policy is determined by the Constitution. It is very clear, solemn and peaceful. The principle of seeking a peaceful solution to conflicts will become the basis of our foreign policy. This is our policy and it will always be so.' According to the TASS report, Sheinbaum also said that her 'main task is to manage Mexico'. 'I will attend some international events that we think are important, but we will not travel often - our responsibility is here (Mexico). ' Sheinbaum said. According to Xinhua News Agency, Sheinbaum announced her victory in the presidential election on June 3, and she will become the first female president in the history of Mexico. Russian media quoted the Mexican Embassy in Russia on August 7 as saying that Mexico has invited Russian President Vladimir Putin to attend the inauguration ceremony of Mexico's elected president Sheinbaum on October 1 local time. In response to Mexico's invitation, Ukraine had previously requested that if Putin was invited to attend the inauguration ceremony of Mexico's elected president, Sheinbaum, the Mexican government should arrest the former, but the request was rejected by the current Mexican President Lopez on August 8 this year. 1726647066928 Copyrighted works of Global Network. title: 暑运旺季中国民航旅客运输量创新高 支线航空热
summary: 中新社北京9月3日电 (尹倩芸)2024年暑运(7月1日至8月31日)收官，多家航司发布暑运数据。据中国南方航空3日消息，暑运期间南航集团旅客运输总量超过2950万人次，日均超47万人次，执行国际及地区客运航班接近1.6万班，国际运输旅客量超过280万人次。 其中中东等区域航线航班增长明显，南航投入的航班量超2019年同期水平。从国内至新加坡、马来西亚、阿联酋等国的运力及旅客运输总量已超过2019...
text: 中新社北京9月3日电 (尹倩芸)2024年暑运(7月1日至8月31日)收官，多家航司发布暑运数据。据中国南方航空3日消息，暑运期间南航集团旅客运输总量超过2950万人次，日均超47万人次，执行国际及地区客运航班接近1.6万班，国际运输旅客量超过280万人次。 其中中东等区域航线航班增长明显，南航投入的航班量超2019年同期水平。从国内至新加坡、马来西亚、阿联酋等国的运力及旅客运输总量已超过2019年同期水平。 此外，暑运期间中国东方航空及旗下航司累计执行航班18.95万班次，服务2676万人次旅客航空出行，东航共执行国际及地区航班2.46万班次、运输旅客395.36万人次，较2019年同期分别增长2.1%和8.1%。 中国民航局发布数据也显示，今年暑运期间民航旅客运输量创历史新高，全民航累计运输旅客1.4亿人次，日均228.9万人次，比2019年增长17.7%，比2023年增长12.3%。 暑运期间，民航日均客座率83.9%，比2023年增加2.6个百分点。累计保障航班115.7万班，日均保障18660班，比2023年同期增长8.2%。国内航空运输骨干网支撑作用明显，进出港旅客量较高的有广州白云、北京首都、上海浦东、深圳宝安、成都天府等机场，支线航空运输市场火热。 航旅纵横暑运总结报告也显示，支线机场连通性较往年明显增长，二三线城市市场显示出较大增长潜力。 【责任编辑：刘维佳】
translated_summary: China News Service, Beijing, September 3 (Yin Qianyun) The 2024 summer travel season (July 1 to August 31) has come to an end, and many airlines have released summer travel data. According to China Southern Airlines on the 3rd, during the summer travel season, the total passenger transportation volume of China Southern Airlines Group exceeded 29.5 million, with an average of more than 470,000 passengers per day, and nearly 16,000 international and regional passenger flights were carried out, with international passenger volume exceeding 2.8 million. Among them, flights on regional routes such as the Middle East have increased significantly, and the number of flights invested by China Southern Airlines has exceeded the same period in 2019. The capacity and total passenger transportation volume from China to Singapore, Malaysia, the United Arab Emirates and other countries has exceeded the same period in 2019. In addition, during the summer travel season, China Eastern Airlines and its affiliated airlines have cumulatively carried out 189,500 flights, serving 26.76 million passengers on air travel. China Eastern Airlines has carried out 24,600 international and regional flights and transported 3.9536 million passengers, an increase of 2.1% and 8.1% respectively over the same period in 2019. Data released by the Civil Aviation Administration of China also showed that during this year's summer travel season, civil aviation passenger transport volume hit a record high, with a total of 140 million passengers transported by the entire civil aviation industry, an average of 2.289 million passengers per day, an increase of 17.7% over 2019 and 12.3% over 2023. During the summer travel season, the average daily passenger load factor of civil aviation was 83.9%, an increase of 2.6 percentage points over 2023. A total of 1.157 million flights were guaranteed, with an average of 18,660 flights per day, an increase of 8.2% over the same period in 2023. The domestic air transport backbone network has a significant supporting role. Airports with a high number of inbound and outbound passengers include Guangzhou Baiyun, Beijing Capital, Shanghai Pudong, Shenzhen Bao'an, Chengdu Tianfu, and the regional air transport market is hot. The Air Travel Summer Transport Summary Report also shows that the connectivity of regional airports has increased significantly compared with previous years, and the second- and third-tier city markets have shown great growth potential. [Editor: Liu Weijia]

title: 官媒抨擊網紅滋擾日本遊客「蹭流量」 評論：民族主義是中共專利
summary: 繼中國網紅「張教官」在巴黎長榮桂冠酒店以酒店沒掛上中國國旗造文章，成功博取流量後，上周六（7日）一名納米網紅「亞人」在圓明園與日本遊客僱用的中國翻譯發生爭執。中國官媒一反縱容態度，指「盲日排外在我國沒有土壤，民族大義不是流量密碼」。有評論指，中共使用民族主義的界線，在於是否可服務中共的外交或內政目標。 亞人：Are you guys from Japan? 導遊：是的，是日本人。 亞人：我剛聽你說...
text: 繼中國網紅「張教官」在巴黎長榮桂冠酒店以酒店沒掛上中國國旗造文章，成功博取流量後，上周六（7日）一名納米網紅「亞人」在圓明園與日本遊客僱用的中國翻譯發生爭執。中國官媒一反縱容態度，指「盲日排外在我國沒有土壤，民族大義不是流量密碼」。有評論指，中共使用民族主義的界線，在於是否可服務中共的外交或內政目標。 亞人：Are you guys from Japan? 導遊：是的，是日本人。 亞人：我剛聽你說人語，幫我問問他們是不是日本人。 導遊：日本人，是啊！ 亞人：給日本人讓座，在圓明園這個地方？ 導遊：你給誰讓不一樣？哪個國家的人沒關係的。 亞人：沒有關係嗎？我覺得有關係。 導遊：那你覺得有關係就算了。 亞人：我很在意這件事。你作為一個中國人，你讓我給日本人讓地方，我就不懂。 導遊：你可以不讓。讓你往那邊一點點照個相，這不是跟你商量嗎？ 亞人：這句話你就不應該問，在圓明園。 擁有32萬粉絲的微型網紅「亞人」在圓明園，被一名受僱於日本遊客的中國翻譯要求「讓一下」，以便他們照。亞人堅持「中國人不應讓日本人」，與翻譯發生爭執，並全程拍攝。當翻譯和日本遊客離去，「亞人」仍不肯罷休。圓明園的管理圓前來了解，但竟然與「亞人」站在同一陣線。 管理員：說白了就是不讓進的 導遊：那你要說這地個也有點......你這是管理處的意見嗎？有點不對吧。 管理員：因為去年整個團隊，整個日本團隊就沒讓進。 亞人：還要讓中國人讓地方給日本人拍東西 導遊：我哪裡不尊重你？ 管理員：憎恨小鬼子，就那麼簡單 官媒罕有以道德打擊小粉紅 《環球時報》旗下《環球人物》周日（8日）在微博抨擊「亞人」，指「盲日排外在我國沒有土壤，民族大義不是流量密碼，自以為抓住了『增粉神器』，沒想到無人捧場。」又指「大部分網友認為無端阻止日本遊客拍照，非常不合適，有損大國形象。」更指「亞人」在美國留學期間有犯罪記錄。 2019年，《鳳凰周刊》曾報道中國留學生李高陽因涉嫌性侵未成年人及勒索，試圖返回中國時在洛杉磯機機被捕。從照片看來，李高陽跟「亞人」非常相似。《環球人物》帖文一出，即有不少網紅附和，拍片點評「亞人」的行為。而「亞人」亦將以往幾百條影片刪除 民族主義是中共專用 南華大學亞太研究所所長孫國祥表示，中國長期使用民族主義作為工具，尤其是對外鬥爭時凝聚國內團結，今次網紅事件可以看出，不是人人可以隨便使用這個工具。 孫國祥說：「中共可能真的對民族主義的使用有一條界線，當民族主義情緒，可以服務於中共政府的外交或內政目標時，它就會受到鼓勵。但是這種民族主義情緒，一旦威脅到中國本身的國際形象或國內秩序的話，他可能就會受到抑制。」 《環球人物》的帖文亦提到，中國144小時過境免簽政策，已經讓外國遊客感受到中國的開放親和，令英美澳媒體中國「濾鏡式報道」不攻自破。 孫國祥指，中國在疫後致力開放旅遊，吸引外國人和台商投資，網紅的行為會讓外國人卻步，直接打擊經濟。在這條界線下，台灣人若在中國接受「九二共識」和「一中原則」，他就會受到保護。大陸人對台灣人的騷擾，從北京的角度看就會削弱台灣人對大陸的好感，破壞兩岸融合的努力。
translated_summary: After the Chinese social networking site "Chang Teacher" successfully gained traction after posting a Chinese flag-less article in the prestigious Crown Hotel in Paris, a Nano social networking site "Asian" got into a dispute with a Chinese translator employed by Japanese tourists in Round Mountain Park on Saturday (7). China's official media has repeatedly condoned this attitude, saying that "there is no soil in our country, and the national motto is not a traffic code". Some commentators have suggested that the CCP uses nationalist lines to serve its diplomatic or domestic goals. Are you guys from Japan? Guide: Yes, they are Japanese. A: I just heard you speak in Japanese, so please ask me if they are Japanese. Guide: Japanese, yes. Asian: Give the Japanese a seat in this place, in the circular garden? Guide: Who do you give it to? AM: Is it related? I think it is. Guide: That's what you think is relevant. A: I'm very interested in that. I don't understand why you, as a Chinese, let me give space to the Japanese. Guide: You can't. He said, "It is not for you to ask about it in the Garden of Eden". A Chinese translator hired by a Japanese tourist as a translator asked the 320,000-fan micro-networker "Ayan" in Round Mountain Park for permission to take a photo. Ayan insists that "Chinese shouldn't be allowed to speak Japanese", arguing with the translator and filming the whole thing. When the translator and the Japanese tourists left, the "Asian" still refused to quit. In the meantime, the administration of Yulinming Garden has come to understand, but it turns out that they are on the same side as the "Ayan people". Administrator: To talk is to not let in a guide: So you're saying there's something to this place. I'm not sure. I'm not sure. I'm not sure. I'm not sure. I'm not sure. Do you think this is the opinion of those in authority? Administrator: Because last year the whole team, the whole Japanese team, didn't let us in. Ayan: Let the Chinese give the place to the Japanese to shoot things Guides: Where I don't respect you? Administrator: Hate the little guy, it's as simple as that The official media rarely beat the little pink with morality "Most netizens think that stopping Japanese tourists from taking pictures is very inappropriate and damages the image of the country. The term "Asian" refers to a person who has a criminal record while studying in the United States. In 2019, Liu Weekly reported that Li Gaoyang, a Chinese student, was arrested on a plane in Los Angeles while attempting to return to China on suspicion of sexual assault of minors and extortion. According to the photographs, Lee Gaoyang is very similar to "Asian". In a post on social media, Yang writes that there are a lot of tweets and videos criticizing the "Asian" behavior. Sun Guanxiang, director of the Nationalist Institute of Asia and the Pacific at the University of South China, said that China has long used nationalism as a tool, especially in foreign conflicts, to consolidate domestic unity. Sun said: "The CCP may really have a line on the use of nationalism, and it is encouraged when it serves the diplomatic or domestic goals of the CCP government. But such nationalistic sentiments can be suppressed if they threaten China's own international image or domestic order. "China's 144-hour visa-free travel policy has allowed foreign tourists to feel China's open-mindedness, which has prevented US-Australian media from "filtering" China. Sun pointed out that China is committed to opening up tourism after the pandemic to attract foreign and Taiwanese investment, and that the behavior of the Internet will put foreigners off and directly hit the economy. Under this line, Taiwanese are protected in China if they accept the 1992 Consensus and the One China Principles. From Beijing's point of view, harassment of Taiwanese by mainlanders undermines Taiwanese sympathy for the mainland and undermines efforts to integrate the two sides.

title: The Assignment with Audie Cornish
summary:
Trump’s Close Call Re-Shapes the Race The Assignment with Audie Cornish America was shaken on Saturday as former president Donald Trump survived an assassination attempt during a campaign rally in Pennsylvania.
Jul 4, 2024 35 minsGeorgia’s Swing-State Spotlight The Assignment with Audie Cornish During the 2020 election, there was perhaps no bigger upset than Joe Biden carrying Georgia.
Nikki Haley Voters The Assignment with Audie Cornish More than 158,000 Republicans cast Pennsylvania primary votes for Nikki Haley nearly two months after she quit the race for president.
Jun 24, 2024 36 minsA New Generation of Storytellers The Assignment with Audie Cornish What does it mean for a news story to matter?
The Assignment with Audie Cornish What can we learn about the future of our elections from political prediction markets?
text:
Trump’s Close Call Re-Shapes the Race The Assignment with Audie Cornish America was shaken on Saturday as former president Donald Trump survived an assassination attempt during a campaign rally in Pennsylvania. It’s an event of historical significance that’s already re-shaping the presidential race. Kristen Holmes is here to explain how. She’s the CNN correspondent assigned to the Trump campaign, and Kristen and Audie met up on Monday at the CNN-POLITICO Grill on day one of the Republican National Convention in Milwaukee. Jul 15, 2024 25 mins

Why We Can’t Look Away From Reality TV The Assignment with Audie Cornish Reality television has turned into a sprawling industry of pimple-poppers, amazing racers, the broken hearted, docusoaps, and sooo many housewives – people willing to share the good and bad of their lives with an audience that by design is meant to judge them for it. It also gave us a president. Audie talks with Pulitzer Prize winning New Yorker writer Emily Nussbaum about how and why reality shows have become must-see TV. Her new book, “Cue The Sun! The Invention of Reality TV.” Jul 11, 2024 31 mins

The Cracks in the Blue Wall The Assignment with Audie Cornish Michigan and Wisconsin are Midwestern swing states with the power to make or break the election. They’re crucial bricks in the Democrats’ “Blue Wall” strategy, a wall that’s starting to crack. On this third installment of “All Over the Map,” John King and his team visit Milwaukee, site of next week’s Republican convention and home to a Black liberal base increasingly disaffected with a President and party they feel abandoned by. In Detroit, many, especially in the Arab-American community, are heartbroken and angry over President Biden’s response to the war in Gaza. Two voters, Eric and Ibrahim, give us their takes — and remind us why we’re traveling “all over the map”. Jul 8, 2024 33 mins

What It Means to Be Patriotic The Assignment with Audie Cornish This Independence Day, as we gather around the grill and watch fireworks with our friends and families, we wanted to revisit a conversation Audie had with Baratunde Thurston, writer at Puck News and host of the PBS show America Outdoors. What does it mean to love this country despite its divisions? How can we come together and hold space for the complexity of the American story? And what would those conversations sound like if we did? Baratunde Thurston is a writer, host and executive produc ... Show more er of the PBS television series America Outdoors, creator and host of How To Citizen, and a founding partner of the new media startup Puck. His comedic memoir, How To Be Black, is a New York Times best-seller. Jul 4, 2024 35 mins

Georgia’s Swing-State Spotlight The Assignment with Audie Cornish During the 2020 election, there was perhaps no bigger upset than Joe Biden carrying Georgia. This was the first time a Democrat had won the reliably red state in three decades — in years past, Democrats didn’t even think to campaign in the state. So, how do Georgia voters feel about their newfound swing state status? And will this change the way they vote in November? On this second installment of our series “All Over the Map,” John King and his team visit with two small-business owners aware of their electoral power. Jul 1, 2024 33 mins

What It’s Like to Be a Diplomat The Assignment with Audie Cornish Between Russia's war with Ukraine and Israel's war with Hamas, it feels like we're seeing the limits of diplomacy. Can we still depend on global alliances and good old-fashioned negotiations to solve the problems of today, or are we better off trying a different approach? Audie speaks with Julianne Smith, United States Permanent Representative to NATO, about the state of U. S. diplomacy and what it looks like when diplomacy works and when it doesn't. Jun 27, 2024 31 mins

The Key to Pennsylvania? Nikki Haley Voters The Assignment with Audie Cornish More than 158,000 Republicans cast Pennsylvania primary votes for Nikki Haley nearly two months after she quit the race for president. That’s enough votes to swing a state critical to victory in November – and Haley had similar showings in other battlegrounds. So, how do these critical swing voters choose between Joe Biden and Donald Trump – two candidates they do not like? In the first installment of a three-part series, CNN Chief National Correspondent John King travels to Pennsylvania to hear Haley voters share their doubts about Biden, Trump, and the future of the Republican Party. Jun 24, 2024 36 mins

A New Generation of Storytellers The Assignment with Audie Cornish What does it mean for a news story to matter? To have impact on YOU, the audience? Does it have to be about a person who has been wronged? An institution caught in a cover up? Do you need to feel like it could affect your life personally? Audie wrestled these questions while serving as judge for this year’s Livingston Awards, which recognize impactful journalism by reporters under the age of 35. She calls up this year’s winners: Allison Behringer and Lila Hassan, for their work covering medical ... Show more mysteries for the Bodies podcast, and Samantha Hogan for her deep dive into probate and guardianship in Maine. You can check out more of their award-winning reporting below: Early Birds episode of Bodies The Fight for Abortion Training episode of Bodies Calls to overhaul Maine probate courts have stalled for half a century. The most vulnerable people may be at risk by Samantha Hogan Eight deaths raise questions about oversight of Maine’s public guardianships by Samantha Hogan Jun 20, 2024 27 mins

How Popular Is Election Betting? The Assignment with Audie Cornish What can we learn about the future of our elections from political prediction markets? Audie calls up Thomas Gurca, Director of Iowa Electronic Markets (IEM), an online futures market that includes political betting. He explains what makes prediction markets different from traditional gambling and how IEM continues to predict presidential elections with better accuracy than the polls. Jun 17, 2024 27 mins

Documenting the Golden Age of Hip-Hop The Assignment with Audie Cornish Filmmaker and journalist dream hampton’s new documentary, “It Was All a Dream,” chronicles the “the golden age of Hip-Hop" in the early 1990’s. She talks with Audie about the film, which is made up of footage she shot in the 90’s that’s been in storage for 30 years: hanging out with Biggie Smalls in the studio, Lil’ Kim in the neighborhood, and interviews with a before-he-was famous Snoop Dog. Through her writing at publications like The Source, Vibe, Essence, and The Village Voice, dream became a critical activist voice — committed to the music and to the artists that she was constantly demanding more of. Learn more about “It Was All a Dream” and watch the trailer. Jun 13, 2024 35 mins

title: All There Is with Anderson Cooper
summary:
Sharing Our Grief All There Is with Anderson Cooper This episode, the season finale, is a reminder that none of us is alone in our grief.
“This is grief,” she tells Anderson, “it just looks beautiful.” Jan 24, 2024 28 minsNicole Chung: Carrying Memories Alone All There Is with Anderson Cooper When best-selling author Nicole Chung’s adoptive parents died, she felt all alone.
Dec 20, 2023 36 minsThe Greatest Loss All There Is with Anderson Cooper Katie Talman, was grieving an unimaginable loss when she left a message for Anderson Cooper, one of more than a thousand voicemails he received from podcast listeners.
Dec 6, 2023 38 minsFacing Our Grief All There Is with Anderson Cooper Grief doesn’t just go away, no matter how hard we may want it to.
These are the questions Anderson Cooper struggles to answer after the first season of All There Is ends.
text:
Sharing Our Grief All There Is with Anderson Cooper This episode, the season finale, is a reminder that none of us is alone in our grief. Anderson shares some of the thousands of extraordinarily moving voicemail messages he’s received from listeners. Feb 7, 2024 35 mins

A Son’s Struggle, A Father’s Grief All There Is with Anderson Cooper Charlie Shelin was an exceptionally bright child who worked hard for years to keep the dark thoughts in his head from consuming him. In this moving conversation, his dad, Randy, talks with Anderson about Charlie’s mental health struggles and the layers of grief their family has lived with for years. Jan 31, 2024 32 mins

Mama Shu: Turning Loss Into Love All There Is with Anderson Cooper Shamayim Harris, known in Detroit as Mama Shu, knows all too well the pain of loss. In 2007 her 2-year-old son Jakobi Ra was killed in a hit and run accident, and in 2021 her other son Chinyelu was murdered. Mama Shu talks with Anderson about how she worked hard to, in her words, “turn my grief into glory and my loss into love.” Focusing on one block in her neighborhood, she began cleaning up blighted properties and has created the non-profit Avalon Village, which aims to be a safe and welcoming space for kids in her community. “This is grief,” she tells Anderson, “it just looks beautiful.” Jan 24, 2024 28 mins

Nicole Chung: Carrying Memories Alone All There Is with Anderson Cooper When best-selling author Nicole Chung’s adoptive parents died, she felt all alone. Her family had unraveled, and there was no one else who remembered what she was like as a little girl. Nicole speaks with Anderson about carrying her parents’ memories alone and the search for her birth parents, which led to a series of surprising discoveries. You can call and leave a message at: (917) 727-6818. We'd especially like to hear if there's something that you've learned in your grief that might help others. Jan 17, 2024 37 mins

Ashley Judd: Grief, Love and Naomi All There Is with Anderson Cooper When Naomi Judd died by suicide in 2022, after a long struggle with mental illness, her daughter Ashley found her. In this deeply moving, revealing, and insightful conversation Ashley Judd talks about the trauma she has worked hard to face, the grief she now feels, and how her mother’s spirit is still very much alive in her life. Jan 10, 2024 41 mins

Revisiting Stephen Colbert: Grateful for Grief All There Is with Anderson Cooper The podcast is taking a short break, new episodes of All There Is will return January 10th. In the meantime, we are sharing Anderson's powerful conversation with Stephen Colbert from the first season of the podcast. Can we learn to love the things we most wish had never happened? Can we really become grateful for grief? Heartbreak? The deaths of loved ones? Stephen believes we can and explains why and how. It is a deeply moving, thought-provoking, and at times funny conversation that Anderson says has had a major impact on his life. Dec 27, 2023 52 mins

Love, Loss and Parenting All There Is with Anderson Cooper Amanda Petrusich, a talented writer for The New Yorker who often covers music, lost her husband, Bret Stetka, suddenly in 2022. Their daughter, Nico, was just 13 months old. Amanda talks with Anderson about grieving an unexpected loss, while navigating life as a single parent. They also explore the constantly changing nature of grief, the role music has played for Amanda and how she talks about Bret with her daughter. Dec 20, 2023 36 mins

The Greatest Loss All There Is with Anderson Cooper Katie Talman, was grieving an unimaginable loss when she left a message for Anderson Cooper, one of more than a thousand voicemails he received from podcast listeners. Anderson called Katie back at her home in Texas and she agreed to share her story. When Katie was 23 weeks pregnant, her daughter Everly died. “Nothing could have prepared me to deliver a stillborn baby,” Katie says. The grief over her daughter’s death, the silence in the delivery room, the inability of some in her life to understand or even acknowledge the depth of her pain - Katie and Everly’s story is a moving testament to a family’s love and a mom’s courage in the face of the greatest loss. Dec 13, 2023 32 mins

A President’s Grief All There Is with Anderson Cooper “You gotta come home, there's been an accident.” It was 1972 when Joe Biden heard the news that changed his life forever: his wife Neilia and 13-month-old daughter Naomi were killed in a car crash. Decades later his beloved son Beau died of cancer. In this deeply personal interview President Biden reveals how he has found solace in his grief and learned to search for purpose beyond his pain. Dec 6, 2023 38 mins

Facing Our Grief All There Is with Anderson Cooper Grief doesn’t just go away, no matter how hard we may want it to. So how can we live with it and learn from it? These are the questions Anderson Cooper struggles to answer after the first season of All There Is ends. Anderson spends months playing more than 1000 unheard voicemail messages about grief from podcast listeners, and once again finds himself in his basement surrounded by boxes, full of letters, photos and objects that belonged to his late father, mother, and brother. He also talks with psychotherapist and author Francis Weller, whose book “The Wild Edge of Sorrow” gives him hope. Nov 29, 2023 36 mins

title: Chasing Life with Dr. Sanjay Gupta
summary:
The Habits of Happy People Chasing Life Have you ever wondered why some people seem naturally happier than others?
He and Dr. Sanjay Gupta discuss how confidence might be the most important resource for well-being and why imposter syndrome isn’t such a bad thing.
Jun 25, 2024 38 minsA Conversation with Dr. Anthony Fauci Chasing Life Dr. Anthony Fauci became a household name during the COVID-19 pandemic as director of the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases.
Dr. Fauci sits down for an interview with CNN Chief Medical Correspondent Dr. Sanjay Gupta to discuss his life and new memoir "On Call: A Doctor’s Journey in Public Service."
Dr. Sanjay Gupta hears how gratitude helped one woman navigate a life-changing medical diagnosis.
text:
The Habits of Happy People Chasing Life Have you ever wondered why some people seem naturally happier than others? Or if there are any universal keys to happiness? Sanjay sits down with social psychologist and University of California Riverside Professor Sonja Lyubomirsky who has been studying happiness for the last 35 years. The author of The How of Happiness discusses her findings and what she calls “happiness interventions” as well as how we can apply these practices in our own lives to boost our happiness. Jul 16, 2024 34 mins

Want to be Happier? Confidence Can Help Chasing Life Trying new things. Setting Goals. Rebounding from setbacks. All of these tasks have at least one thing in common – they require confidence. And according to neuropsychologist Ian Robertson, confidence can also make us happier. Robertson is the T Boone Pickens Distinguished Chair at the Center for BrainHealth, UT Dallas, an Emeritus Professor at Trinity College in Dublin, Ireland, and author of How Confidence Works: The New Science of Self Belief. He and Dr. Sanjay Gupta discuss how confidence might be the most important resource for well-being and why imposter syndrome isn’t such a bad thing. Jul 9, 2024 38 mins

Your Trauma May Be Making You Sick Chasing Life Have you ever wondered if stress and trauma from your past could be making you sick? Author and trauma expert Dr. Gabor Maté, says our past experiences may literally be the root cause of “trauma related illness,” something he writes about in his most recent book, “The Myth of Normal: Trauma, Illness, and Healing in a Toxic Culture.” Drawing on his experience as both a Holocaust survivor, and a physician, Mate sits down with Dr. Sanjay Gupta for an intimate and wide-ranging conversation to share his steps for healing and living happier lives. Jul 2, 2024 38 mins

How Exercise Can Make Us Happier Chasing Life When it comes to finding joy and happiness, exercise is not always top of mind but maybe it should be. Exercise benefits our physical health as well as helps to reduce anxiety, stress and symptoms of depression, yet many Americans say exercise is not something they enjoy. So where’s the disconnect? And how can people consistently reap the “feel good” benefits of exercise? Health psychologist and author of The Joy of Movement: How Exercise Helps Us Find Happiness, Hope, Connection and Courage, Ke ... Show more lly McGonigal talks with Sanjay about the why moving your body can be a source of joy and hope. And for listeners who say they don’t enjoy exercise or have limited mobility, she has some tips that might turn things around. Jun 25, 2024 38 mins

A Conversation with Dr. Anthony Fauci Chasing Life Dr. Anthony Fauci became a household name during the COVID-19 pandemic as director of the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases. But the coronavirus pandemic wasn’t the first public health crisis Dr. Fauci helped Americans navigate, or the first time he’s come under fire. Dr. Fauci sits down for an interview with CNN Chief Medical Correspondent Dr. Sanjay Gupta to discuss his life and new memoir "On Call: A Doctor’s Journey in Public Service." Jun 18, 2024 31 mins

Are We Prepared for Bird Flu? Chasing Life An update on the current bird flu outbreak: it’s still infecting wild birds, mammals and now several farmworkers in the United States. The virus does not appear to be transmitted between humans, but can we prevent further spread? And what are public health officials doing to contain it? Immunologist and virologist Rick Bright has been studying the bird flu for decades and tells Dr. Sanjay Gupta why he thinks more action is needed and who he thinks should be leading the charge. Jun 11, 2024 34 mins

Should Everyone Consider Therapy to Be Happier? Chasing Life With the surge in telemedicine, therapy has seen a remarkable rise in popularity. But could therapy hold the key to a happier life? And should everyone go to therapy? Sanjay speaks with psychotherapist Lori Gottlieb, acclaimed author of "Maybe You Should Talk to Someone," and co-host of the Dear Therapists podcast, about how therapy can actually change your brain and get you one step closer to achieving happiness. Plus, Lori sheds light on the surprising ways therapy can reshape your perspective, especially for those who are therapy-curious. Jun 4, 2024 34 mins

Can Anxiety Be A Good Thing? Chasing Life Do you spend time worrying about what could go wrong in the future, or stressing about something you did or said in the past? That nagging feeling has a name: anxiety. But what if worrying about preventing anxiety is actually getting in the way of our happiness? New York University neuroscientist Wendy Suzuki is on a mission to help more people accept, and even embrace, what she calls “the most misunderstood emotion.” In this episode, we’ll explore an unexpected solution to happiness: embracing ... Show more stress and how accepting “good” anxiety can help us feel happier and more at ease with uncomfortable feelings. Plus, Professor Suzuki explains why our society’s obsession with avoiding anxiety and negative emotions may be doing more harm than good. May 28, 2024 29 mins

Is There A Science To Happiness? Chasing Life Have you ever wondered: What does it mean to be truly happy? Can our brain chemistry, or even our genetics, determine how we feel about our lives? And, most importantly, can we learn to be even happier? Cognitive scientist and Yale University Psychology Professor Laurie Santos has spent her career researching these questions. As the host of The Happiness Lab, Laurie has gone on her own journey to discover what it truly means to be happy. On today’s podcast episode, Professor Santos will share her findings and how she says we can re-train our brains to make better choices, build better habits, and ultimately, be happier. May 21, 2024 31 mins

The Benefits of Gratitude Chasing Life It turns out a simple “thank you” really can go a long way. In fact, giving thanks doesn’t just make others feel good – it can also boost your own mental and physical well-being. Dr. Sanjay Gupta hears how gratitude helped one woman navigate a life-changing medical diagnosis. Plus, how you can implement a gratitude practice into your daily life. This episode originally aired on May 17, 2022. May 14, 2024 32 mins

title: ABOUT CNN DIGITAL
summary:
CNN Digital is the world leader in online news and information and seeks to inform, engage and empower the world.
Staffed 24 hours, seven days a week by a dedicated team in CNN bureaus around the world, CNN’s digital platforms deliver news from almost 4,000 journalists in every corner of the globe.
CNN DIGITAL MISSION:To Inform, Engage and Empower the WorldWe are truth-seekers and storytellers.
STUDIO TOUR:The CNN Studio Tour offers visitors a behind-the-scenes look at CNN.

text:
CNN Digital is the world leader in online news and information and seeks to inform, engage and empower the world. Staffed 24 hours, seven days a week by a dedicated team in CNN bureaus around the world, CNN’s digital platforms deliver news from almost 4,000 journalists in every corner of the globe.

CNN DIGITAL MISSION:

To Inform, Engage and Empower the World

We are truth-seekers and storytellers.

We are journalists, designers and technologists, united by a mission to inform, engage and empower the world.

We bear witness to history as it unfolds and explain not just what happened, but why, and what it means to you.

Our products and platforms take you to the farthest corners of the world, and they bring the world to you, delivering content and services that enrich your lives, your families and your communities.

We are available on more screens in more places than any other news source.

We stand for excellence in our journalism and our products.

We are committed to serving you.

We are CNN.

WHAT’S ON:

The full rundown of all CNN daily programming.

WHO’S ON:

Bios on all of CNN’s anchors, correspondents and executives.

STUDIO TOUR:

The CNN Studio Tour offers visitors a behind-the-scenes look at CNN. Take a look back at CNN’s history-making coverage of news events that have shaped the world and get a peek at state-of-the-art studios where these events are reported daily to over one billion people worldwide.

CNN’S PARENT COMPANY:

Warner Bros. Discovery, Inc.

SHOP CNN:

Check out the CNN Store for hats, shirts, bags and more.

SERVICES:

CNN MOBILE SERVICES:

CNN.com content is now available through your mobile phone. With CNN mobile services, you can read up-to-the-minute news stories with color photos, watch live, streaming video or the latest Video On Demand clips and receive CNN Breaking News text alerts. No matter where your on-the-go lifestyle takes you, CNN brings the news directly to you.

E-MAIL NEWSLETTERS:

Be the first to know with a variety of e-mail news services. Receiving breaking news alerts, delivered straight to your e-mail address. Follow the latest news on politics, technology, health or the topics that interest you most. Or stay informed on what’s coming up on your favorite CNN TV and Headline News programs.

CNN offers e-mail updates as numerous and diverse as your tastes. Register now and select from the various e-mails.

SUBMIT A STORY IDEA:

Have a story idea? Click Here

SUBMIT FEEDBACK:

Have something to say? Click Here

LEGAL TERMS AND CONDITIONS:

CNN INTERACTIVE SERVICE AGREEMENT:

View the terms of the CNN Interactive Services Agreement.

PRIVACY STATEMENT:

To better protect your privacy, we provide this notice explaining our online information practices and the choices you can make about the way your information is collected and used: CNN Privacy Statement.

title: Quelles sont les stratégies d'influence de la Russie en Afrique ?
summary: Des footballeurs adolescents écoutent l'hymne national russe avant un match. À proximité, des artistes peignent le portrait du président russe Vladimir Poutine sur un mur lors d'un festival de graffit...
text: Des footballeurs adolescents écoutent l'hymne national russe avant un match. À proximité, des artistes peignent le portrait du président russe Vladimir Poutine sur un mur lors d'un festival de graffitis. Bienvenue au Burkina Faso, l'un des pays africains où la Russie multiplie les opérations pour gagner en influence. Les preuves trouvées par la BBC montrent que la Russie utilise des initiatives médiatiques et culturelles pour attirer les journalistes, les influenceurs et les étudiants africains tout en diffusant des informations trompeuses. Ces événements sont promus par African Initiative, une organisation médiatique russe nouvellement créée qui se définit comme un « pont d'information entre la Russie et l'Afrique ». Elle a hérité des structures précédemment mises en place par le groupe mercenaire Wagner, qui a été démantelé, et les experts pensent qu'elle a des liens avec les services de sécurité russes. Enregistrée en septembre 2023, un mois après la mort du chef de Wagner, Evgeniy Prigozhin, dans un accident d'avion, African Initiative a accueilli d'anciens employés des entreprises démantelées de Wagner et de Prigozhin. Ses efforts se sont particulièrement concentrés sur les trois régimes militaires du Mali, du Niger et du Burkina Faso, dans le Sahel. À la suite de récents coups d'État, ces pays ont pris leurs distances avec leurs alliés occidentaux, comme la France, en critiquant l'échec de leurs interventions contre les groupes djihadistes et leur héritage colonial. Ils se sont plutôt tournés vers la Russie. Parallèlement aux événements culturels organisés sur le terrain, African Initiative gère un site web d'information proposant des articles en russe, en anglais, en français et en arabe, ainsi qu'une chaîne vidéo et cinq chaînes Telegram, dont l'une compte près de 60 000 abonnés. Certaines des chaînes Telegram ont été « recyclées » à partir de chaînes plus anciennes créées par l'entreprise de Prigozhin. Elles ont été les premières à promouvoir le groupe paramilitaire Africa Corps du ministère russe de la défense, qui a effectivement remplacé l'aile militaire de Wagner en Afrique de l'Ouest. Les récits pro-Kremlin et les informations trompeuses, en particulier sur les États-Unis, sont monnaie courante. Des articles publiés sur le site web de l'African Initiative laissent entendre, sans preuve, que les États-Unis utilisent l'Afrique comme terrain de production et d'expérimentation d'armes biologiques, en s'appuyant sur des campagnes de désinformation du Kremlin depuis longtemps discréditées. L'un des articles reprend les affirmations infondées du Kremlin selon lesquelles des laboratoires biologiques américains ont été transférés de l'Ukraine vers l'Afrique. Un autre article affirme sans preuve que les laboratoires biologiques américains se multiplient sur le continent, affirmant que « sous couvert de recherche et de projets humanitaires, le continent africain est en train de devenir un terrain d'essai pour le Pentagone », suggérant que le pays est impliqué dans des expériences biologiques secrètes dans la région. Alors que les efforts de propagande de Prigozhin visaient principalement la France, African Initiative « vise davantage les Américains », déclare le chercheur Jedrzej Czerep, analyste de l'Afrique et chef du programme Moyen-Orient et Afrique de l'Institut polonais des affaires internationales. « Elle est beaucoup plus antiaméricaine. La "tournée" de la guerre En juin, un groupe de blogueurs et de journalistes de huit pays a été invité à un « voyage de presse » de sept jours dans les zones d'Ukraine occupées par la Russie. Le voyage a été organisé par les médias d'État russes et des fonctionnaires russes sanctionnés par l'Occident, et les journalistes ont visité le siège d'African Initiative à Moscou. « L'Afrique ne recevait pas beaucoup d'informations [sur la guerre] », a déclaré à la BBC Raymond Agbadi, un blogueur et scientifique ghanéen qui a étudié en Russie et qui a participé au 'voyage de presse'. « Les informations que nous recevions n'étaient pas assez convaincantes pour nous permettre de comprendre ce qu'était réellement la guerre. Un journaliste ghanéen et un journaliste malien ont également participé au voyage. L'influenceur américain Jackson Hinkle, un fervent partisan du président russe Vladimir Poutine qui a diffusé de nombreuses fausses informations sur l'Ukraine, a également participé à la visite. « Ils sont rentrés épuisés mais satisfaits », a écrit un site d'information pro-Kremlin qui a rendu compte du voyage. Après avoir visité Moscou, les journalistes ont parcouru 1 250 kilomètres jusqu'à la ville portuaire ukrainienne de Mariupol, dans la région de Donetsk. Ils se sont ensuite rendus dans des villes de la région de Zaporizhzhia, toutes des zones dont la Russie s'est emparée au début de son invasion massive de l'Ukraine. Tout au long de la visite, les reporters ont été accompagnés par des fonctionnaires russes et ont voyagé avec des militaires russes dans des véhicules marqués du signe Z, symbole de l'invasion de l'Ukraine par la Russie. En mai, African Initiative avait déjà organisé un autre « voyage de presse » à Mariupol, occupée par la Russie, pour une délégation de blogueurs maliens. Les voyages de presse de journalistes organisés par différents pays sont un outil bien connu pour tenter de vendre les points de vue d'un pays. Mais alors que « les médias occidentaux offrent une formation progressive [aux journalistes] afin qu'ils puissent rendre compte de sujets clés qui sont devenus des préoccupations mondiales, la Russie utilise ces visites guidées comme un moyen de propager certains récits », explique Beverly Ochieng, analyste principal chez Control Risks et au Centre for Strategic and International Studies Africa, en soulignant que la Chine organise des initiatives similaires. Le fait que des journalistes africains rendent compte de leur voyage donne une « impression d'authenticité » parce qu'ils « s'adressent au public dans des langues qu'il reconnaît », plutôt que de donner l'impression que cela fait partie d'une « campagne plus large visant à présenter la Russie sous un jour positif », ajoute Mme Ochieng. Dans les articles publiés depuis le voyage, les journalistes africains qualifient les villes ukrainiennes occupées par les forces russes de « zones de conflit en Russie » et citent les autorités installées par les Russes, faisant ainsi écho à la propagande de l'État russe et présentant le point de vue du Kremlin sur les frontières de l'Ukraine.
